channel.name: CanonicalForeignField as a type in ZkProgram

messages.content: It isn't possible to give publicOutput's type in the ZkProgram. Why is it? Error thrown states that it is caused by the way it is exported, namely: `export type {CanonicalForeignField}`. If you remove type keyword from the source code, it is possible to give it as an Output type, but i don't see why.
Can you share some example code?

CanonicalForeignField part shows error :

'CanonicalForeignField' cannot be used as a value because it was exported using 'export type'.ts(1362)
foreign-field.d.ts(8, 72): 'CanonicalForeignField' was exported here.
I thought that publicOutput/publicInput accepts ProvablePure types. However, error thrown is explained as above.

`publicOutput: Secp256k1Curve.Scalar.Canonical,` - this would be valid syntax, but not sure if it's what you need.  The point is `CanonicalForeignField` is a valid type for all foreign fields.  It's a generic type.  For a zk program, you need to specify the actual size of the field you're working with.  It can't just be any random foreign field.

Idk what `ECDHSecp256k1.computeSharedSecret(userPrivateKey, peersPublicKey);` is supposed to return.  You want the output to actually be the definition of the curve itself?

Let's say this program isn't provable, what is the actual value you want to return here?
I'm trying to implement provable elliptic curve diffie hellman on secp256k1
here is the function;
it should basically return the output of scalar multiplication, which is the shared secret
Feel free to check this out for more context: https://cryptobook.nakov.com/asymmetric-key-ciphers/ecdh-key-exchange
Oh good idea, thank you. Interestingly I got *TypeError: peersPublicKey.scale is not a function*

> When I try to execute this zkProgram, I get Error: ForeignCurve not initialized any ideas? I

@Deniz this is because you use the `ForeignCurve` (base) class directly, this doesn't work. It's supposed to be subclassed to a concrete curve using `createForeignCurve()`

So instead of
```ts
publicOutput: ForeignCurveV2
```
you need
```ts
publicOutput: Secp256k1
```
no need to redefine a struct for curve points, this is already what `Secp256k1` gives you!

so, this might be confusing because what we call "provable types" are not (just) "typescript types", they are in fact typescript _values_. usually implemented as a class so that you get a value (the class) + type (the type of class instances) that have the same name.

the zkprogram `publicOutput` field expects to be given a _value_. In fact using a TS type in this place is not even valid TypeScript:

```ts
ZkProgram({
    name: "exampleCode",
    publicOutput: CanonicalForeignField // THIS IS A VALUE, CAN'T BE A TYPE
```
Thanks for the detailed explanation Gregor. Here is provable ECDH on secp256k1 https://github.com/0x471/o1js-ecdh-secp256k1 🙂
